intro: Brachionidium pusillum, commonly known as the small brachionid, is a minute aquatic plant belonging to the order Charales. It is characterized by its simple, branched thallus that typically grows in freshwater environments. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead consisting of a central axis with various specialized structures. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling. Due to its small size, it is often overlooked but is an important component of freshwater biodiversity.
